articles.headline: New Housing Program Is Aimed at the Unemployed
articles.snippet: An initiative from the Obama administration is meant to allow eligible homeowners to postpone all or part of their mortgage payments for a year or more.
articles.abstract: An initiative from the Obama administration is meant to allow eligible homeowners to postpone all or part of their mortgage payments for a year or more.
articles.lead_paragraph: Help is on the way from the federal government for some homeowners struggling to make their mortgage payments because of prolonged joblessness.

articles.headline: I.R.S. Drops Audits of Political Donors
articles.snippet: The Internal Revenue Service abandoned forcing five big-ticket donors to pay gift taxes on contributions they made to nonprofit groups that are increasingly important in politics.
articles.abstract: The Internal Revenue Service abandoned forcing five big-ticket donors to pay gift taxes on contributions they made to nonprofit groups that are increasingly important in politics.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Internal Revenue Service on Thursday abandoned its effort to force five big-ticket donors to pay gift taxes on contributions they made to nonprofit advocacy groups that are playing an increasing role in American politics.

articles.headline: Ethanol Subsidies Besieged
articles.snippet: Pressure to cut the federal budget may outweigh support for the subsidies as consensus builds that the ethanol industry has achieved financial stability.
articles.abstract: Pressure to cut the federal budget may outweigh support for the subsidies as consensus builds that the ethanol industry has achieved financial stability.
articles.lead_paragraph: Federal subsidies for corn ethanol have long been considered untouchable in Washington — not least because politicians want the votes of Iowans, who have traditionally held the first nominating caucuses in the contest for the presidency.

articles.headline: As Wall St. Polices Itself, Prosecutors Use Softer Approach
articles.snippet: Justice Department guidelines adopted in 2008 allow prosecutors to grant leniency to companies that investigate and report their own wrongdoing.
articles.abstract: Justice Department guidelines adopted in 2008 allow prosecutors to grant leniency to companies that investigate and report their own wrongdoing.
articles.lead_paragraph: As the financial storm brewed in the summer of 2008 and institutions feared for their survival, a bit of good news bubbled through large banks and the law firms that defend them.
articles.byline: By Gretchen Morgenson and Louise Story

articles.headline: To Slow Piracy, Internet Providers Ready Penalties
articles.snippet: Internet providers agreed to a system to identify those suspected of digital copyright infringement and impose progressively harsher consequences.
articles.abstract: Internet providers agreed to a system to identify those suspected of digital copyright infringement and impose progressively harsher consequences.
articles.lead_paragraph: Americans who illegally download songs and movies may soon be in for a surprise: They will be warned to stop, and if they don’t, they could find their Internet access slowing to a crawl.

articles.headline: Accounting That Comes in Flavors
articles.snippet: The United States is considering whether to adopt international accounting standards, which it will probably do if it can rewrite some of the rules.
articles.abstract: The United States is considering whether to adopt international accounting standards, which it will probably do if it can rewrite some of the rules.
articles.lead_paragraph: The world was supposed to be moving to a single set of high quality accounting standards, ones that would make financial statements comparable around the world.

articles.headline: South Sudan, the Newest Nation, Is Full of Hope and Problems
articles.snippet: When the Republic of South Sudan declares independence on Saturday, it will be as a poor country facing insurrections and hostilities with northern Sudan.
articles.abstract: When the Republic of South Sudan declares independence on Saturday, it will be as a poor country facing insurrections and hostilities with northern Sudan.
articles.lead_paragraph: JUBA, Sudan — After five decades of guerrilla struggle and two million lives lost, the flags are flapping proudly here in this capital. The new national anthem is blasting all over town. People are toasting oversize bottles of White Bull beer (the local brew), and children are boogieing in the streets.

articles.headline: Job Growth Falters Badly, Clouding Hope for Recovery
articles.snippet: For the second month in a row, employers added a dismally small number of jobs, showing that the United States economy is barely creaking along.
articles.abstract: For the second month in a row, employers added a dismally small number of jobs, showing that the United States economy is barely creaking along.
articles.lead_paragraph: For the second consecutive month, employers added scarcely any jobs in June, startling evidence that the economic recovery is stumbling.
